snippet: Johnson & Johnson faces a wave of lawsuits from patients who say they were injured when all-metal implants sold by the company failed.
abstract: DePuy Orthopaedics, unit of Johnson & Johnson, will phase out production of all-metal replacement hips, move that reflects industrywide trend to abandon once widely used implants because of high early failure rates; company has faced wave of lawsuits from patients claiming injury after failure.
lead_paragraph: Johnson & Johnson faces a wave of lawsuits from patients who say they were injured when all-metal implants sold by the company failed.

headline.main: J.&J. Unit Phasing Out All-Metal Hip Devices
headline.print_headline: J.&J. Unit Phasing Out All-Metal Hip Devices
